content: beginner crochet market bag a charlotte yarn pattern by cristi brockway & sandy harris offered as a free ravelry download with permission of remi haygood owner of charlotte yarn supplies 1 hank louet euroflax linen worsted size g crochet hook darning needle locking stitch marker optional abbreviations half_double_crochet half-double_crochet double_crochet double_crochet single_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch chain chain increase half_double_crochet twice into stitch of previous row instructions the circular base make a loop and make 8 half-double crochets into the loop end with a chain 2 tip tie the loop as if you are performing the first step in tying your shoes this makes the loop stable and easy to hold while you hold your yarn to crochet into the loop pull the end of the yarn to close the loop tight round 1 half_double_crochet twice into each half_double_crochet of previous row 16 stitches slip_stitch to join last stitch to first ch2 do this at the end of each round round 2 *half_double_crochet 1 increase* 24 stitches round 3 *half_double_crochet 2 increase* 32 stitches round 4 *half_double_crochet 3 increase* 40 stitches round 5 *half_double_crochet 4 increase* 48 stitches round 6 *half_double_crochet 5 increase* 56 stitches round 7 *half_double_crochet 6 increase* 64 stitches round 8 *half_double_crochet 7 increase* 72 stitches round 9 *half_double_crochet 8 increase* 80 stitches round 10 *half_double_crochet 9 increase* 88 stitches end chaining only one after you join with a slip stitch without cutting the yarn perform a slip stitch along the perimeter of the circle into each stitch of the outside round see picture at right this slip_stitch chain will be on one side or the other of the circle you have made not along the outside rim the bag when the slip_stitch edge is complete chain 3 counts as first double_crochet and double_crochet into each slip_stitch on the base slip_stitch to join 88 dcs including first chain 3 at this point you may choose to place a locking stitch marker to indicate the beginning of round you will be working in a spiral for the body of the bag so it is not important that the marker travel with you each round set up round chain 5 skip 3 stitches single_crochet 1 chain 5 skip 3 stitches single_crochet 1 do this all the way around end with a chain 3 and single_crochet into the 1st loop created in this set up round pattern row chain 5 single_crochet into loop below all the way around for a total of 23 rounds strap single_crochet 4 into the loop below single_crochet 1 into single_crochet of row below single_crochet 5 into loop below this is the base of your strap continue in single_crochet on the 10 stitches you just made for the length of the entire strap the strap is a total of 10 stitches wide and will be a total of 15 inches long or the length you want join strap to other side by single_crochet 10 times around loops & into the last row of stitches on the strap
